column1: Agriculture remains prominent in the area
column2: but Moorhead is also home to notable corporate
column3: manufacturing and distribution industries
column4: including American Crystal Sugar (corporate headquarters and sugar beet processing)
column5: Busch Agricultural Resources (malt manufacturing) and Pactiv (container manufacturing). The unemployment rate is consistently below the national average and property values are stable.

column1: The Rourke Art Gallery and the Rourke Art Museum are native Moorhead cultural institutions hosting the annual Midwestern Invitational Exhibition. The museum displays an important art collection from local
column2: regional and national artists. The Rourke Museum is housed in the historic Moorhead Post Office building.

column1: The city is also home to the Bluestem Center for the Arts a 3
column2: 000 seat outdoor amphitheater and Trollwood Performing Arts School
column3: a renowned Summer arts and theater program.  Bluestem opened in 2009 with a partnership between the Fargo School District
column5: and an arts grant from the Minnesota.   Jade Presents also presents a summer concert series which has drawn many famous bands including: Wilco

column1: The Hjemkomst Center is located in the city. It is a museum containing a re-creation of a Viking ship of the same name. The Hjemkomst vessel was built in nearby Hawley by Moorhead resident Robert Asp
column2: and was sailed to Norway by his children after Asp's early death. The ship is now permanently housed in the center.

column1: The Clay County Museum and Archives
column2: operated by the Clay County Historical Society
column3: interprets the history of Clay County in a free museum in the lower level of the Hjemkomst Center. The Society has more than 30
column5: one of the largest and most important historic collections in Minnesota outside of the Minneapolis-St. Paul area.

column1: Located on the grounds of the Hjemkomst Center is a Stave Church. The traditional Norwegian-style church serves as a symbol of the Norwegian heritage in the Red River Valley. The church is a full-scale replica of the Hopperstad stave church in Vik
An additional historical landmark is the Victorian Comstock House
column2: a blend of Queen Anne and Eastlake styles built in 1883. Solomon Comstock was a lawyer and U.S. House Representative.

column1: The Fargo-Moorhead RedHawks is an independent professional baseball team that plays at Newman Outdoor Field in Fargo. They are part of the American Association.

column2: hockey has emerged as a favorite sport of Moorhead. The community has provided significant support to hockey programs such as Moorhead Youth Hockey. Over the years

column1: Moorhead's pioneer Prairie Home Cemetery on 8th Street was the inspiration for the name of Garrison Keillor's national radio program
column2: A Prairie Home Companion. Although Keillor thought the cemetery was founded by Norwegian Lutherans
column3: in fact it was organized in 1875 by the Rev. Oscar Elmer
column4: a Yankee Presbyterian minister who was the first ordained Christian minister in the Moorhead/Fargo area.
